snippet: Ramona Rodríguez, 51, sought refuge on Tuesday in the office of a congressman after complaining that Cuba’s communist government takes too big a slice of her pay, the authorities said.
abstract: Ramona Rodriguez, Cuban doctor working in Brazil, seeks asylum, complaining that Cuba’s communist government takes too big a slice of her pay; she is one of 7,378 Cubans who are in Brazil as part of a program that hires foreign doctors to tend the sick in slums and remote rural locations and is the first to defect.
lead_paragraph: Ramona Rodríguez, 51, sought refuge on Tuesday in the office of a congressman after complaining that Cuba’s communist government takes too big a slice of her pay, the authorities said.
